'''Raticate''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ラッタ''' ''Ratta'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Rattata}} starting at [[level]] 20.

In [[Alola]], Raticate has a [[regional variant]] that is {{2t|Dark|Normal}}. It evolves from Alolan Rattata when leveled up at [[Time|night]] starting at level 20.

==Biology==
Raticate is a large rodent Pokémon. Although it is often depicted on its hind legs, it is a quadruped. It is mostly tawny colored with a cream underside. It has large incisors that grow constantly. There are three whiskers on each side of its face, which it uses to maintain balance. It has webbed feet with three toes that allow it to swim. Its tail is long and scaly, and its ears have a ragged appearance. Females will have shorter whiskers and lighter fur.

If attacked, Raticate stands up on its hind legs, bares its fangs and shrieks in an intimidating manner at its enemy. These teeth are strong enough to gnaw through steel. It is willing to take on larger foes if provoked enough. It often needs to gnaw on something, like rocks and logs. It may even chew on the wall of houses, and is capable of chewing cinder walls and toppling concrete buildings. Its large incisors are also used for its former [[signature move]]s, {{m|Hyper Fang}} and {{m|Super Fang}}. This Pokémon typically lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|plains and savannas}}.

In Alola, Raticate has become heavier and darker due to its urban environment and higher calorie diet. Its fur is mostly black with a brown, leaf-shaped patch on its belly and brown inside its ears. Its hands, feet, cheeks, and tail are a whitish-cream color, and its hands are much smaller. It has large, puffy cheeks with four whiskers under its chin and two sprouting sideways from the top of each cheek. Its large incisors are still visible, but its eyes are now red. This variant uses its nest as a food stockpile, and generally prefers to have the Alolan {{p|Rattata}} it commands collect food while it remains in its nest and eats. It is selective in what it eats, however, only eating fresh, high quality foods. Rumor has it that a certain high-class restaurant even exploits this selectivity, bringing Raticate along to buy ingredients and letting it taste test new dishes.<ref>http://www.pokemon-sunmoon.com/en-us/pokemon/alolan-raticate/</ref>

===In the main series===
====Major appearances====
=====[[Ash's Raticate]]=====
On the [[S.S. Anne]], {{Ash}} [[trade]]d his {{AP|Butterfree}} for a Raticate in ''[[EP015|Battle Aboard the St. Anne]]'' but traded it back in the same episode as the boat was still sinking.

=====Other=====
[[Cassidy]] has a Raticate that for a time served in her and [[Butch]]'s [[Team Rocket mottos#Butch and Cassidy|motto]] the role that {{MTR}} serves in the {{motto}} of [[Jessie]] and [[James]]. It has appeared in ''[[EP057|The Breeding Center Secret]]'', ''[[EP157|The Fortune Hunters]]'', and ''[[AG176|The Ole' Berate and Switch]]''.

A differently colored Raticate appeared in ''[[EP083|Poké Ball Peril]]'', although it is not Shiny.

[[Mollie]] has a Raticate, which she used during the [[Appeal|Appeals Round]] of the [[Gardenia Town]] [[Pokémon Contest]] in ''[[AG167|What I Did for Love]]''.

Multiple [[Regional variant|Alolan]] Raticate debuted in ''[[SM009|To Top a Totem!]]''.

Multiple Alolan {{DL|Totem Pokémon|Ally Raticate}} appeared in ''[[SM025|A Team-on-Team Tussle!]]'', where they were helping the {{DL|Totem Pokémon|Totem Raticate}} to protect a [[Darkinium Z]] from {{TRT}}, [[Tupp]], [[Zipp]], and [[Rapp]].

A {{tc|Team Skull Grunt}}'s Raticate will appear in [[SM065]].

====Minor appearances====
A Raticate was seen in a [[Pokémon Center]] in ''[[EP030|Sparks Fly for Magnemite]]''.

A Raticate was used in a Pokémon Race during ''[[EP033|The Flame Pokémon-athon!]]''.

In ''[[EP042|Showdown at Dark City]]'', Raticate is one of the Pokémon belonging to one of the {{pkmn|Trainer}}s at [[Kas Gym]].

A Raticate appeared in ''[[EP047|A Chansey Operation]]'', where it was one of the injured Pokémon brought to the clinic.

A Raticate appeared in ''[[EP052|Princess vs. Princess]]'', where it was seen competing in the {{DL|Princess Festival|Queen of the Princess Festival contest}}.

A Raticate appeared in ''[[M01|Mewtwo Strikes Back]]''.

A few Raticate were seen in ''[[EP065|Showdown at the Po-ké Corral]]'', living at [[Professor Oak's Laboratory]], along with many other Pokémon.

A Raticate appeared in ''[[EP069|Lights, Camera, Quack-tion]]'', as part of the cast for the movie "{{DL|Movies in the Pokémon world|Pokémon in Love}}".

A Raticate appeared in ''[[EP075|Round One - Begin!]]'', under the ownership of a Trainer competing in the [[Indigo Plateau Conference]].

A Trainer's Raticate appeared in ''[[EP080|Friends to the End]]'', during the closing ceremonies of the Indigo Plateau Conference.

{{OBP|Ralph|EP100}} and {{OBP|Emily|EP100}} were both shown in a flashback to have once owned one Raticate each in ''[[EP100|Wherefore Art Thou, Pokémon?]]''.

A Raticate appeared in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]''.

In ''[[EP136|Chikorita's Big Upset]]'', a Trainer used a Raticate to {{pkmn|battle|fight}} against [[Ash's Chikorita]].

Two Raticate were among the Pokémon seen at the [[Pokémon Swap Meet]] in ''[[EP146|Tricks of the Trade]]''.

A Raticate appeared in a flashback in ''[[EP185|The Light Fantastic]]''.

A Raticate was one of the Pokémon living at [[Temacu's father]]'s lab in ''[[EP198|The Heartbreak of Brock]]''.

A Raticate appeared in ''[[M04|Celebi: The Voice of the Forest]]''.

In ''[[EP228|Extreme Pokémon!]]'', a Raticate appeared with its Trainer, participating in the [[Extreme Pokémon Race]].

A Raticate appeared in ''[[The Legend of Thunder!]]''.

Multiple Raticate appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]''.

A Raticate appeared in ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]'', where it was one of the Pokémon living in the [[Tree of Beginning]].

A Raticate appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

A Raticate appeared in ''[[SM003|Loading the Dex!]]'' as a silhouette that [[Rotom Pokédex]] brought up.

An Alolan Raticate appeared in ''[[SM013|Racing to a Big Event!]]'', where it participated in the Pancake Race.

Two Alolan Raticate appeared in ''[[SM015|Rocking Clawmark Hill!]]'', as some of the Pokémon training up on [[Clawmark Hill]].

A Trainer's Alolan Raticate appeared in ''[[SM040|Balloons, Brionne, and Belligerence!]]''.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Alolan Raticate and its Alolan {{p|Rattata|pre-evolution}}.
** They are also the only Normal-type Pokémon with a double weakness.
* Raticate's [[catch rate]] was 90 in [[Generation I]] and {{Gen|II}}, but this was changed to 127 in [[Generation III]].
* Raticate is the only Pokémon that shares its [[National Pokédex]] number with the level at which it evolves from its pre-evolution.
* Raticate and its {{p|Rattata|pre-evolution}} share their {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Pikachu}}, {{p|Raichu}}, {{p|Sandshrew}}, and {{p|Sandslash}}. They are all known as the Mouse Pokémon.
** They all have at least one family member with a [[regional variant]] in Alola.

===Origin===
Raticate most resembles a {{wp|muskrat}}, a semi-aquatic rodent, due to the large teeth, whiskers, fur, and body shape. Its scruffy ears look like those of a {{wp|guinea pig}}. Its webbed feet may be inspired by the {{wp|coypu}}, a South American rodent.

Alolan Raticate may be based off the {{wp|Polynesian rat}}.

====Name origin====
Raticate seems to be a combination of ''{{wp|rat}}'' and ''eradicate'' (to destroy or exterminate) or ''masticate'' (to chew), relating to its mouth and teeth.

Ratta is likely derived from ''rat''.
